channel.title: xmlhack
channel.description: Developer news from the XML community

image.title: xmlhack
image.description: News, opinions, tips and issues concerning XML development

item.title: Avalanche of XML Query drafts
item.description: Jonathan Robie announced the release of five W3C Working Drafts related to XML Query/XQuery work.

item.title: Requirements for XSLT, XPath 2.0
item.description: While battles rage over the future of XSLT 1.1, the W3C has moved ahead with requirements documents for XSLT 2.0 and XPath 2.0.

item.title: James Clark updates TREX sample implementation
item.description: James Clark has announced an update to the sample Java implementation he created for his TREX validation language.

item.title: PSGML mode for Emacs: v1.2.2 released
item.description: Lennart Staflin has announced the release of v1.2.2 of PSGML, an Emacs major mode for editing XML and SGML documents.

item.title: XML Data Management Benchmark Unveiled
item.description: Timo Boehme of the database group at the University of Leipzig has announced XMach-1, a scaleable, multi-user benchmark for XML data management systems.

item.title: XML Fragment Interchange resurrected as CR
item.description: Over nineteen months since its previous inception as a Working Draft, XML Fragment Interchange has become a W3C Candidate Recommendation.
